III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• The agency was informed that regarding signatures on PATP's, signatures
are not required if a social work contact documents that the PATP was
reviewed with relevant parties and that they were given a copy of the
PATP.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 04/02/2024 in
response to those policy violations established during the renewal inspection
completed on 02/06/2024. The agency was cited during the renewal inspection for
policy violations, FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans, FOM 722-06H Case Contacts,
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting, and FOM 801-03 Medical Passport. The
current inspection did not establish any repeat violations.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed and found to be thorough.
The assessment identified staffing shortages due to three staff being on parental
leave during the licensing period. The agency had to transfer some cases back to
DHHS or to another CPA to maintain caseload compliance. The assessment also
addressed other barriers such as high needs foster children and the lack of dental
and health care providers.
The assessment noted that the agency has a stable team with the existence of
worker longevity being the norm.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed including a certified public accountant audit.
There were no concerns noted.
Staff Interviews:
Staff interviewed report they like working for the agency. They stated that they feel
supported by the Chief Administrator who serves as their supervisor. Staff further
reported that they are part of a supportive, high functioning team.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a building in downtown Marquette. There is adequate
office space. CHRI documents were not viewed as they were destroyed a few
years ago when the chief administrator became the CA of the agency. She was
unaware of the rule at the time. This was addressed under Technical Assistance in
the 02/05/2024 renewal inspection report.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified two safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are as
follows:
Safety Alert #1 The safety alert was generated on 01/08/2025 as the home was
missing a smoke alarm in the basement between sleeping area and the rest of the
home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 01/09/2025 as the smoke alarm was installed
and a photo provided.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on 01/22/2025 as the home was lacking a
carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution: A carbon monoxide detector was installed on 01/23/2025 and a photo
provided.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
May 13, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 14, 2025

Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
4
